subject: Physical Fitness
title: More Protein Doesn't Mean More Muscle
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on More Protein Doesn't Mean More Muscle.

hook.text: Fitness influencers eat 300 grams of protein a day. Science says half that amount is plenty.

buildup.text: Research consistently shows 1.6 g protein per kg of bodyweight maximizes muscle protein synthesis.

discovery.text: Beyond that threshold, extra protein is burned for energy or excreted. It won't build more muscle.

twist.text: Spreading protein across 3â€“4 meals works better than one massive intake. Each meal caps synthesis.

climax.text: For a 75 kg person, that's about 120 g daily â€” achievable through normal food without supplements.

punchline.text: Enough protein builds muscle. Extra protein builds expensive urine.
